title: What do you think of Steve Winwood? - Quora

response.answer_text: Anyone who can crack the big time at 16 years of age is pretty special. Not to mention that in addition to being a pretty fair singer, he’s an accomplished multi-instrumentalist. Having said that, I admit to never having been a big fan. Spencer Davis had its moments, but Traffic and Blind Faith outside of a few songs like “40,000 Headmen” or “Can’t Find My Way Home” never really connected. Some of Winwood’s solo efforts I’ve liked - his remake of the Timmy Thomas song, “Why Can’t We Live Together” is rather good - but taken as a whole, he’s a middle-of-the-roader for me.

What’s not to love — great voice, great player, lots of classic tunes! I especially like his singing on this one from the Go project of Stomu Yamashta, Steve Winwood and Michael Shrieve:  Beautiful guitar solo from Pat Thrall on this song. Al Di Meola also had prominent moments on the album. (I don’t recall who was the lyricist) Live version:
